1.text: Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son causeth a father to rejoice, And a foolish son is an affliction to his mother.

2.text: Treasures of wickedness profit not, And righteousness delivereth from death.

3.text: Jehovah causeth not the soul of the righteous to hunger, And the desire of the wicked He thrusteth away.

4.text: Poor is he who is working—a slothful hand, And the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

5.text: Whoso is gathering in summer is a wise son, Whoso is sleeping in harvest is a son causing shame.

6.text: Blessings are for the head of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.

7.text: The remembrance of the righteous is for a blessing, And the name of the wicked doth rot.

8.text: The wise in heart accepteth commands, And a talkative fool kicketh.

9.text: Whoso is walking in integrity walketh confidently, And whoso is perverting his ways is known.

10.text: Whoso is winking the eye giveth grief, And a talkative fool kicketh.

11.text: A fountain of life is the mouth of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.

12.text: Hatred awaketh contentions, And over all transgressions love covereth.

13.text: In the lips of the intelligent is wisdom found, And a rod is for the back of him who is lacking understanding.

14.text: The wise lay up knowledge, and the mouth of a fool is near ruin.

15.text: The wealth of the rich is his strong city, The ruin of the poor is their poverty.

16.text: The wage of the righteous is for life, The increase of the wicked for sin.

17.text: A traveller to life is he who is keeping instruction, And whoso is forsaking rebuke is erring.

18.text: Whoso is covering hatred with lying lips, And whoso is bringing out an evil report is a fool.

19.text: In the abundance of words transgression ceaseth not, And whoso is restraining his lips is wise.

20.text: The tongue of the righteous is chosen silver, The heart of the wicked—as a little thing.

21.text: The lips of the righteous delight many, And fools for lack of heart die.

22.text: The blessing of Jehovah—it maketh rich, And He addeth no grief with it.

23.text: To execute inventions is as play to a fool, And wisdom to a man of understanding.

24.text: The feared thing of the wicked it meeteth him, And the desire of the righteous is given.

25.text: As the passing by of a hurricane, So the wicked is not, And the righteous is a foundation age-during.

26.text: As vinegar to the teeth, And as smoke to the eyes, So is the slothful to those sending him.

27.text: The fear of Jehovah addeth days, And the years of the wicked are shortened.

28.text: The hope of the righteous is joyful, And the expectation of the wicked perisheth.

29.text: The way of Jehovah is strength to the perfect, And ruin to workers of iniquity.

30.text: The righteous to the age is not moved, And the wicked inhabit not the earth.

31.text: The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, And the tongue of frowardness is cut out.

32.text: The lips of the righteous know a pleasing thing, And the mouth of the wicked perverseness!
